entry.title: A new event display for the KLOE-2 experiment
entry.summary: In this contribution we describe KNEDLE - the new event display for the KLOE-2 experiment. The basic objectives and software requirements are presented. The current status of the development is given along with a short discussion of the future plans.

entry.title: Studies of mesic nuclei via decay reactions
entry.summary: Collisions in a system of two particles at energies close to a bound state in different channels are discussed. Next, the bound state decays into a third coupled channel. A phenomenological approach to dd->pi-p3He reaction is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure Presented at International Symposium on Mesic Nuclei, Krakow, Sept. 20, 2013

entry.title: Feasibility of ortho-positronium lifetime studies with the J-PET detector in context of mirror matter models
entry.summary: We discuss the possibility to perform the experimental searches of invisible decays in the ortho-positronium system with the J-PET detector

entry.title: Search for eta-mesic helium using the WASA-AT-COSY detector
entry.summary: We conduct a search for the 4He-eta bound state with the WASA-at-COSY facility via the measurement of the excitation function for the reaction dd->3Heppi-. In first experiment performed in June 2008, we used COSY deuteron beam with a slowly ramped beam momentum corresponding to a variation of the excess energy for the 4He-eta system from -51.4 MeV to 22 MeV. Here we report on the status of the measurement and the data evaluation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at Symposium on Meson Physics: extended COSY-11 collaboration meeting, Cracow, Poland, 1-4 Oct 2008, 8 pages, 5 figures,

entry.title: Search for eta-mesic nuclei with WASA-at-COSY
entry.summary: We search for an evidence of eta-mesic He with the WASA detector. Two dedicated experiments were performed at the Cooler Synchrotron COSY-Juelich. The experimental method is based on the measurement of the excitation functions for the two reaction channels: dd->3Heppi- and dd->3Henpi0, where the outgoing N-pi pairs originate from the conversion of the eta meson on a nucleon inside the He nucleus.In this contribution, the experimental method is shortly described and the current status of the analysis is presented.

entry.title: Search for the manifestation of the mesic-nuclei on the dd-->3HeNpi excitation function measured with WASA-at-COSY
entry.summary: We search for an evidence of eta-mesic 4He with the WASA-at-COSY detector. Two dedicated experiments were performed at the Cooler Synchrotron COSY-Juelich. The experimental method is based on the measurement of the excitation functions for the two reaction channels: dd-->3Heppi- and dd-->3Henpi0, where the outgoing N-pi pairs originate from the conversion of the eta meson on a nucleon inside the He nucleus. In this contribution, the experimental method is shortly described and preliminary excitation functions from the 2010 data are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 12 figures, Presented at International Symposium on Mesic Nuclei, Krakow, Sept. 20, 2013

entry.title: Recent results from KLOE-2
entry.summary: The most recent results from the KLOE experiment are presented, covering: the measurement of the running fine-structure constant alpha_em,the Dalitz plot measurement of eta to pi+pi-pi0, the search of a U boson, tests of discrete symmetries and quantum coherence. The KLOE-2 Collaboration will take data until mid 2018 aiming to collect 5 inversed fb increasing the data set, in order to produce new precision measurements and continue studies of fundamental symmetries and New Physics.

author.name: Wojciech Krzemien
author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of the KLOE-2 collaboration

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures. talk presented at Particles and Nuclei International Conference 2017 (PANIC 2017)

entry.title: Mixing and CPV in charm hadrons at LHCb
entry.summary: LHCb continues to expand its world-leading sample of charmed hadrons collected during LHC's Run 1 (2010-2012) and Run 2 (2015-present). This sample is yielding some of the most stringent tests of the Standard Model understanding of charm physics. This includes precise measurements of the neutral D-meson mixing parameters and some of the most sensitive searches for direct and indirect CP violation in charm interactions.

author.name: Wojciech Krzemien
author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of the LHCb collaboration

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 1 figure, presented at 21st Particles and Nuclei International Conference 2017 (PANIC 2017)

entry.title: Status and Perspectives of the Search for Eta-Mesic Nuclei
entry.summary: In this report the search for eta-mesic nuclei is reviewed. The brief description of the experimental studies is presented with a focus on the possible production of the eta-nucleus bound states for light nuclei like 4He and 3He.
entry.arxiv:comment: Conference Proceedings: The 11th Latin American Symposium on Nuclear Physics and Applications (XI LASNPA), 30.11-04.12.2015, Medellin, Columbia

entry.title: Search for the 3He-eta bound state at COSY-11
entry.summary: We have measured excitation function for dp -> ppp_pi- reaction near the eta production threshold. We observe an enhancement of the counting rate above the threshold which can originate from the production of the eta meson in the reaction dp -> 3He eta and its subsequent absorption on neutron in the 3He nucleus leading to creation of the p_pi- pair.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at 10th International Workshop on Meson Production, Properties and Interaction (MESON 2008), Cracow, Poland, 6 - 10 June 2008, 4 pages, 4 figures,references added
